intro: Centaurea vukotinovicii, commonly known as the Vukotinović's knapweed, is a flowering plant native to the Balkan Peninsula. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads composed of ray and disk florets. The plant typically grows in rocky or dry habitats, showcasing adaptations to arid environments. It has linear to lanceolate leaves and produces bright yellow to orange flowers. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endangered species in its native range.
